Buffetiser

Buffetiser Documentation

Buffetiser is a web application for organising and visualising a shares portfolio. Each investment is shown in its own tab with the variations in price in the tab header. Click on the header to reveal a graph of the share’s price history as well as further summary details. The bottom panel shows a graph and summary details for the portfolio as a whole. Buffetiser is written using Python, Django, Django Rest Framework and React+JS for the front end.


core.services.investment_helpers

async core.services.investment_helpers.fetch(session, url)

Get all the data from the page.

async core.services.investment_helpers.get_investment_and_urls()

Get each Investment and the URL containing the data for that investment. This information can then be used to scrape the page and get the values needed.

core.services.investment_helpers.get_purchase_history(investment)

All the purchases that have been made of this Investment.

core.services.investment_helpers.get_sale_history(investment)

All the sales that have been made of this Investment.

core.services.investment_helpers.get_units_held_at_date(investment, cut_off_date)

This gets all the units held for an Investment up to (and including) a certain date.

core.services.investment_helpers.initiate_async_scape(scraper_function)

Uses ASX data from BigCharts (MarketWatch) to propagate portfolio with share data. There is no official API so data is scraped from their website. Not sure if this breaks terms of use.

This is done asynchronously to improve speed.

async core.services.investment_helpers.scrape(scraper_function)

Scrape the source for each Investment. Update the the live price for each and create an entry into the investment’s value history.


core.services.investment_details

core.services.investment_details.get_all_details_for_investment(investment)

Return a dictionary with all the details required by the front end to render an Investment entry.

Before this is called, the following should be called to ensure the latest data is available:

  • initiate_async_scape(scraper_function_get_daily_change)

  • initiate_async_scape(scraper_function_investment_and_history)

core.services.investment_details.get_average_cost(investment)

The average cost per unit of an investment.

core.services.investment_details.get_credit_debit_history()

Generates the money put into (purchases) and removed (sales) by date for all Investments.

core.services.investment_details.get_investment_price_history(investment)

Return a list of the daily details of an Investment: low, high, close and volume. Used to create a plot of the history of an Investment’s value.

core.services.investment_details.get_portfolio_totals()

Get the profit and percent profit for the whole portfolio.

core.services.investment_details.get_profit_total_and_percentage(investment)

Return the profit in dollars and as a percent.

core.services.investment_details.get_total_cost(investment)

The sum of all purchases of an investment.

core.services.investment_details.get_total_reinvestment_units(investment)

If an Investment has received reinvestment units, return the total number of units received.

core.services.investment_details.get_total_units_held(investment)

Get the number of units held of a particular investment.

core.services.investment_details.get_total_value(investment)

The current total value of an investment.

async core.services.investment_details.scraper_function_get_daily_change(investment_and_url, response)

This function is passed to the scraper functions that will asynchronously iterate through Investments, pull the data from the Investments URLs and provide the data required below. The results are stored in global so they can be pulled whenever required (this seems wrong).

To execute: initiate_async_scape(scraper_function_get_daily_change) Does not need to implement a loop of Investments. The async functions do this.

async core.services.investment_details.scraper_function_investment_and_history(investment_and_url, response)

This function is passed to the scraper functions that will asynchronously iterate through Investments, pull the data from the Investments URLs and provide the data required below.

To execute: initiate_async_scape(scraper_function_investment_and_history) Does not need to implement a loop of Investments. The async functions do this.


core.services.investment_updaters

All the functions to update values for Investments.

core.services.investment_updaters.add_dividend(investment, reinvest, cutoff_date, reinvestment_date, price_per_unit)
Inputs: investment: Investment

reinvest: whether re-investment is enabled for this Investment cutoff_date: the date the dividend price per unit is determined reinvestment_date: the date the dividend was paid units: the number of units of that Investment held at cutoff_date price_per_unit: the price per unit paid out

A dividend can be either paid out or re-invested. Payout: no reinvestment plan setup, dividend is not enough to buy 1 share. (add dividend value to Financials). Reinvest: re-investment plan setup, dividend is enough to buy 1 or more shares.

core.services.investment_updaters.get_plot_data(investment)

Return the history data: low, high, close for an investment. Used to plot value history.

core.services.investment_updaters.nearest(items, pivot)

Find the nearest item (date) in a list.

core.services.investment_updaters.update_history(investment, high, low, last_price, volume)

Add a new element to the History record.


core.models

class core.models.DailyChange(*args, **kwargs)

We need a place to hold the most up-to-date values of each investment. Although only a temporary value, it should be held to provide the information on first start and restart of the app.

exception DoesNotExist
exception MultipleObjectsReturned
class core.models.DividendPayment(*args, **kwargs)

If an Investment doesn’t provide reinvestment or the dividend is insufficient to buy 1 or more shares, the dividend is paid out. Payment is made up of the cutoff date, payment date and the value of money paid.

exception DoesNotExist
exception MultipleObjectsReturned
class core.models.DividendReinvestment(*args, **kwargs)

This holds the details of a dividend that was reinvested into the portfolio. Reinvestment is made up of the cutoff date, the value of the Investment on that date and the number of shares (Investment.units) obtained.

exception DoesNotExist
exception MultipleObjectsReturned
class core.models.History(*args, **kwargs)

This will record the daily value of an Investment per share.

exception DoesNotExist
exception MultipleObjectsReturned
class core.models.Investment(*args, **kwargs)

This represents either Shares or Crypto-currency. There is only one of these of each type:platform:symbol in the system. Each one of these however, can have multiple purchases and sales.

exception DoesNotExist
exception MultipleObjectsReturned
property average_cost_excluding_fees: float

The sum of each purchase made.

property daily_gain: float

The profit or loss for current day.

property total_cost_excluding_fees: float

The sum of the cost each purchase made excluding fees.

property total_fees: float

The sum of the fees for each purchase.

property total_profit: float

The current value of all units held minus all costs.

property total_units: int | float

The sum of all units purchased minus sold units.

property total_value: float

The current value of all units held.

class core.models.Purchase(*args, **kwargs)

The basis of an Investment. Most Investment details are held here.

exception DoesNotExist
exception MultipleObjectsReturned
class core.models.Sale(*args, **kwargs)

Remove shares and update all values.

exception DoesNotExist
exception MultipleObjectsReturned

core.models

class core.views.AllInvestmentsDataView(**kwargs)

This is the main endpoint for the front end. It basically gets all the information required for the UI to display all the data for each Investment. The History data for plots is handled separately.

class core.views.InvestmentViewSet(**kwargs)
serializer_class

alias of InvestmentSerializer

class core.views.PortfolioTotals(**kwargs)

Aggregate all the purchases, sales and values by date for the chart and the overall totals for the header and history for the chart.

core.views.update_all_investments(request, *args, **kwargs)

This updates ALL the data for ALL investments.

core.views.update_daily_changes(request, *args, **kwargs)

When hit, this endpoint updates the daily change values for ALL Investments. As this is just a temporary value that is updated constantly, the previous values are of no use and can be deleted.
